columns.text: This exercise requires us to calculate payments to suppliers.
**Payable Period** measure the average number of days it takes a business to pay its accounts payable.

## Requirement a

Assuming the company pays immediately, we will compute the payments of accounts in this case. It is computed as follows:

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Payment of Accounts} &= \text{Next Quarter Sales}\times{\text{\% of Projected Sales}}\\[10pt]
\end{aligned}$$

Applying the formula in step 2. the payments of accounts per quarter are:

 
| | Q1|Q2|Q3 |Q4 | 
|--|--:|--:|--:|--:| 
| Next Quarter Sales| $\text{\$ 880.00}$|$\text{\$ 840.00}$ |$\text{\$ 930.00}$ |$\text{\$ 931.50}$ | 
| % of Projected Sales|$\underline{\hspace{10pt}\text{30\%}}$ | $\underline{\hspace{10pt}\text{30\%}}$| $\underline{\hspace{10pt}\text{30\%}}$| $\underline{\hspace{10pt}\text{30\%}}$| 
| **Payment of Accounts**|$\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$ 264.00}}}$ | $\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$ 252.00}}}$| $\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$ 279.00}}}$| $\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$ 279.45}}}$|

## Requirement b

Assuming the company has 90-day payables period, the payment will be made on the next quarter. Payment of accounts is computed as follows:

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Payment of Accounts} &= \text{Current Quarter Sales}\times{\text{\% of Projected Sales}}\\[10pt]
\end{aligned}$$

Applying the formula in step 4, the payments of accounts per quarters are:

 
| | Q1|Q2|Q3 |Q4 | 
|--|--:|--:|--:|--:| 
| Next Quarter Sales| $\text{\$ 810}$|$\text{\$ 880}$ |$\text{\$ 840}$ |$\text{\$ 930}$ | 
| % of Projected Sales|$\underline{\hspace{10pt}\text{30\%}}$ | $\underline{\hspace{10pt}\text{30\%}}$| $\underline{\hspace{10pt}\text{30\%}}$| $\underline{\hspace{10pt}\text{30\%}}$| 
| **Payment of Accounts**|$\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$ 243}}}$ | $\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$ 264}}}$| $\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$ 252}}}$| $\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$ 279}}}$|

## Requirement b


Assuming the company has 30-day payables period, the payment in each period is $\frac{2}{3}$ of last period and  $\frac{1}{3}$ of this period. It is computed as follows:

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Payment of Accounts} &= \bigg({\frac{2}{3}}\text{ of current sales}+{\frac{1}{3}}\text{ of next period sales}\bigg)\times{\text{}30\%} \\[10pt]
\end{aligned}$$

Applying the formula in step 4, the payments of accounts per quarter are:
